I don't know how but I am convinced vBulletin can auto-replace texts. Look what's currently happening when you quote an image (thanks to an extra plugin). The tag is replaced with an tag. Even replacing an :emoticon: tag with the actual image is a simple behind the scenes text replacement.

Could be worth if an admin would ask around on the vBulletin Forum.
The thing is, Ã¢Ë†Å¡ is not the same as the funds symbol....

Four ways of doing it:

  1. Add it as a smiley, which requires an image (yuk).
  2. Add a specific term under the Replacement Variable Manager and have it spit out an agreed ASCII character instead (applies retrospectively, but is style-specific and not constrained to post content... so yuk).
  3. Install a mod that can replace post content specifically (overkill, introduces version fragility... so yuk)
  4. Add it as a custom BB Code and use aforementioned ASCII character (best option, simple, but requires fannying around with CKEditor if you want it linked as a button a la Sketchfab)

I suggested this even before 0.24 came out and it got little traction then. Hopefully now it'll get more.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/86303-Forum-Suggestion-Often-used-symbol-bbcode-or-emoticon
